Description: Install Red Hat OpenShift AI (RHOAI) 3.x in a disconnected environment on a two-node cluster: one Single-Node OpenShift (SNO) control plane plus one worker node using two HP servers with NVIDIA A100 GPUs. Image flow is script-based: pull -> scan -> quarantine -> manual import to Artifactory (no oc-mirror).
Define the chosen topology and disconnected environment constraints.

Summary: Two HP Servers - One SNO + One Worker Node
Description: Chosen topology: Install OpenShift with one control plane node (SNO-style) on the first HP server and one worker node on the second HP server. Both nodes are part of the same cluster. The SNO acts as control plane + worker; the second node is a dedicated worker. Satisfies RHOAI minimum 2 worker nodes requirement.

No internet access from the cluster. All container images brought in via manual image pipeline: pull by script on connected host -> scan -> quarantine -> manual import to Artifactory. oc-mirror is NOT used. Operator installation via Kustomize artifacts from separate repository.
All prerequisites before starting the installation.

Red Hat account with OpenShift Cluster Manager access. OpenShift subscription. RHOAI subscription (Red Hat OpenShift AI Self-Managed). Pull secret from console.redhat.com including Artifactory credentials.
OpenShift 4.20 (stable). One control plane node (SNO) + one worker node. Disconnected/restricted network. Cluster admin via IdP (not kubeadmin). See INSTALLATION_PLAN.md.
Control plane (SNO): 32 vCPUs min, 128 GiB RAM min, NVIDIA A100. Worker: 8 vCPUs min (32+ recommended), 32 GiB RAM min (64+ recommended), NVIDIA A100. Both via NVIDIA GPU Operator.

Linux host for pull script. 100 GB free disk. Access to quay.io, registry.redhat.io, registry.access.redhat.com. Tools: skopeo, podman, or crane. Red Hat pull secret. Image list from imageset-rhoai.yaml or rhoai-disconnected-install-helper.

Vulnerability/compliance scans on all pulled images. Quarantine until approved. Artifactory as target registry in disconnected network. Reachable by both control plane and worker. Enough storage for platform, operator, and RHOAI images.
Default StorageClass with dynamic provisioning. IdP and cluster-admin user (kubeadmin not allowed). Open Data Hub must NOT be installed.

Required for LoadBalancer Services on bare metal. MetalLB Operator from Kustomize. Create IPAddressPool with routable IP range. Install before or with RHOAI. imageset-rhoai.yaml includes metallb-operator package.
Object storage (S3-compatible). NVIDIA GPU Operator. Node Feature Discovery (NFD) Operator. cert-manager for model serving (KServe).

Separate repository with Kustomize artifacts for Subscriptions, OperatorGroups, and operator instance CRs (MetalLB, RHOAI, NFD, GPU Operator). Apply with kustomize build | oc apply -f -. Apply in dependency order.
Execute steps in document order. Image flow: script-based pull -> scan -> quarantine -> manual import to Artifactory.

Step-by-step procedures with official Red Hat documentation links.

Procedure: Requirements for OpenShift AI Self-Managed (disconnected guide 3.1). Check: OCP 4.20; SNO 32 CPUs/128 GiB; worker 8+ CPUs/32+ GiB; StorageClass; IdP cluster-admin; no ODH. Configure Samples Operator for restricted cluster.

Summary: Step 2 - Derive Image List and Pull by Script
Description: Image list from imageset-rhoai.yaml or rhoai-disconnected-install-helper. Script with skopeo copy, podman pull, or crane copy. Include platform, operators, RHOAI additional images. Use Red Hat pull secret.

Summary: Step 3 - Scan Quarantine and Import to Artifactory
Description: Scan all pulled images. Quarantine until approved. Manual import to Artifactory preserving paths/tags/digests. Build CatalogSource if oc-mirror not used.

Summary: Step 4 - Configure Cluster to Use Artifactory
Description: Transfer IDMS/ICSP manifests. Create ImageDigestMirrorSet for registry.redhat.io, quay.io redirect to Artifactory. Add additionalTrustBundle if custom CA. Update pull secret. Create CatalogSource.

Summary: Step 5 - Install and Configure Operators via Kustomize
Description: Apply operators Kustomize repo: MetalLB (Subscription, MetalLB instance, IPAddressPool), RHOAI (channel fast-3.x), NFD, GPU Operator, cert-manager, Kueue, Service Mesh. Customize MetalLB IP range, namespaces. Verify: oc get csv, oc get svc -A | grep LoadBalancer.
If not in Kustomize: Create DataScienceCluster, enable workbenches, AI Pipelines, Kueue, model serving (KServe). Ensure cert-manager, Kueue, Service Mesh, GPU Operator, NFD installed first.
Access OpenShift AI dashboard. Add users to OpenShift AI user groups.

Summary: Step 8 - Enable and Verify NVIDIA A100 GPUs
Description: Install NVIDIA GPU Operator and NFD from Artifactory catalog. Verify A100s detected on both nodes. Ensure workloads can request GPUs.
Documented risks and mitigation strategies.

Summary: Risk: Control plane single point of failure
Description: With one SNO + one worker, control plane is SPOF. Accept for dev/test/edge. Use full multi-control-plane for production HA.
One SNO + one worker = two workload nodes. Size SNO at 32 CPU/128 GiB, worker at 8+ CPU/32+ GiB.
Derive image list from imageset-rhoai.yaml or rhoai-disconnected-install-helper. Build operator catalog separately. Use Kustomize repo for operator CRs.
Plan cycles for scan results, approval, import. Avoid assuming one-shot completion.
ImageDigestMirrorSet must map source paths to Artifactory correctly. Catalog must be OCI-compliant. Verify pull patterns.
Ensure script includes every image for chosen RHOAI version. Missing images cause install/runtime failures.
Configure IdP and cluster-admin user before installing RHOAI.
RHOAI 3.0 is new-install only. No in-place upgrade from 2.25. See Red Hat article 7133758.
Ensure default StorageClass exists before RHOAI. Fix per OCP docs if needed.
Configure Samples Operator for restricted network to use mirror registry.
Use NVIDIA GPU Operator from mirrored catalog. Verify OpenShift/RHCOS support for driver version.
Choose IP range not overlapping machineNetwork, service network, DHCP. Ensure routable to both nodes. Size pool for RHOAI LoadBalancer services.
May need to configure DNS after LoadBalancer IP known. See Red Hat article 7133770 for OpenStack/private clouds.
Pipelines, model serving, workbenches need S3-compatible storage. Plan per component.
Both nodes must reach Artifactory. Ensure network/firewall allows.
